Sadly that is true. There is even a story in the bible of a woman pleading with Jesus to heal her daughter. Jesus stated; "It is not meet to take the children's bread, and to cast it to dogs." Jesus basically called her and sick daughter, Dogs. And she said, "Truth, Lord: yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters' table." Here she makes a basic claim that even if her and her daughter be unworthy of aid, that a dog would be treated better than the current approach being offered. Jesus healed the woman's daughter. Now, was Jesus right? Was the woman and her Daughter no better than Dogs? No; this was an error. He was speaking to his sister, though in the end the right option was used.

A dog is a packing animal; the woman was clearly at Jesus side when requesting what she did, outside her pack.
